column1: The doctor or nurse may give you medicines to help you relax and reduce pain.
Another tube, called a stent, is placed in the ureter to drain urine from your kidney.
- X-rays show the kidney stone is too large to pass by itself.
- The kidney stone is causing urinary tract infections.

Ask your doctor about these possible complications: - Pieces of stone left in your body (you may need more treatments) - Bleeding around your kidney - Problems with kidney function, or kidney(s) that stop working - Pieces of the stone blocking urine flow from your kidney, which may cause very bad pain or kidney damage - Kidney infection
Percutaneous nephrostolithotomy or nephrolithotomy almost always helps ease the symptoms of kidney stones.
